articles.title: Apple shares fall almost 9% at US open
articles.description: Apple shares start Thursday US trading down 8.5% in the wake of Wednesday's warning about China sales.
articles.content: Image copyright AFP Apple shares have fallen at the start of trading, after chief executive Tim Cook blamed a slowdown in China sales for falling revenues. Apple opened down 8.5% at $144.08. Late on Wednesday, the iPhone maker said it anticipated revenue of a… [+2810 chars]

articles.title: 'Flayed god' temple uncovered in Mexico
articles.description: Archaeologists believe priests worshipped Xipe Totec by skinning victims and wearing their flesh.
articles.content: Image copyright Melitón Tapia INAH Image caption The sculptures were discovered during an excavation of pre-Aztec era ruins Archaeologists in Mexico say they have made an important discovery, uncovering a temple to Xipe Totec - the pre-Hispanic "Flayed lord".… [+2336 chars]

articles.title: Pope Francis shows off ball-spinning skills

articles.title: North Korea ambassador to Italy 'in hiding'
articles.description: South Korea's spy agency confirms to officials that the top diplomat is in hiding with his wife.
articles.content: South Korea's spy agency has told officials that North Korea's ambassador to Italy has gone into hiding with his wife. The announcement comes amid reports that Pyongyang's top diplomat in Italy had sought asylum from an unidentified Western country. Jo Song-g… [+144 chars]

articles.title: China mission lands on Moon's far side
articles.description: The unmanned space mission is the first landing on the side of the Moon which never faces Earth.
